org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy.faces

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy.faces.Message

  • public abstract class Message
extends java.lang.Object
    Get the message from the PoesysDbBundle properties file or optionally from user-specified files. These are I18N messages that the application can customize in their own version of the properties file PoesysDbBundle.properties. The message class works as a Singleton pattern class that has a list of message files set up when you first access the class.
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

    • Method Detail

      • initializePropertiesFiles

        public static void initializePropertiesFiles(java.util.List<java.lang.String> names)
        Initialize the list of property bundles from the supplied names. The list then contains property bundles in the same order as the input names with the default Poesys/DB bundle last in the list. The application should call this method once as a static initializer.
        Parameters:
        names - the property-file names in package format (for example, com.poesys.db.PoesysDbBundle)

      • getMessage

        public static java.lang.String getMessage(java.lang.String key,
                          java.lang.Object[] args)
        Get the message identified by the key string. Expand the message template from the resource bundle with any arguments supplied in an array of object arguments (String, Integer, and so on). This method uses the default locale.
        Parameters:
        key - the key in the resource bundle that identifies the message
        args - an array of object values to substitute in as arguments
        Returns:
        the completed message

      • getMessage

        public static java.lang.String getMessage(java.lang.String key,
                          java.lang.Object[] args,
                          java.util.Locale locale)
                                   throws java.util.MissingResourceException
        Get the message identified by the key string from the designated locale. Expand the message template from the resource bundles with any arguments supplied in an array of object arguments (String, Integer, and so on). There should be a localized resource bundle for the designated locale; if not, the system uses the default locale. If the message is not a key from the resource bundle, render the message directly as the completed message.
        Parameters:
        key - the key in a resource bundle that identifies the message
        args - an array of object values to substitute in as arguments
        locale - the locale to use to look up the message
        Returns:
        the completed message
        Throws:
        java.util.MissingResourceException - when the method does not find the key in any registered bundle
